Reviews.Title: “Bad from the start”
Reviews.Author: Nichole W
Reviews.Content: We had an event to attend at Lucas Oil. After using a website to book our room and receiving a confirmation number, we arrived at the hotel to find that we had no reservation. My confirmation number didn't matter because I booked through a third party website. After scrambling for several minutes, she found a room that was being held for someone who had not arrived yet. We paid online for a deluxe floor king room. I was told that this room was not available but if I contacted the website I booked through I could get a refund for the difference. Running late to my event at this point I agreed. As she was typing my info in to the computer several people came down complaining that their keys didn't work. Which seems to be a common complaint about this hotel. I then arrived in my room to find a bathroom the size of a closet, and decorated like I was on a submarine. The trim had been stripped from all of the doors and hallways. And there was one tiny mirror in the bathroom. One vending machine in the entire hotel, which was sold out of everything. Very disappointing, especially for the money spent. Next day, I contact the third party website to attempt to get my refund, they call the hotel to verify my story. And I am told that the hotel says they billed the third party website for the entire amount, with no discount. What??? So I call the hotel. "Oh we are sorry. We will tell them the situation." Never again will I stay at the hotel. And never again will I use a third party booking website!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldnt stay there again”
Reviews.Author: reno g Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: need to update rooms / bathroom needs fan/ trim needs to be replace vvrtvrti irv rivrvr vr iirvrivri ivrv

Reviews.Title: “Bad management and Employees”
Reviews.Author: ricky j
Reviews.Content: well the first day I checked in, right from the start they gave me a bad key, i had to get back into the elevator run all the way back down and tell them the key doesn't work,,,let me also remind you that this was at 2am in the morning,,i grab my luggage go back up and opened my door,,wow what a surprise,,my room looked like someone just had sex and left it within minutes,,i call downstairs to request someone to come up and see the room, not one manager on site or anyone couldn't come up...the girl downstairs gave me another room and again i had to go back downstairs cause she was the only one there...NOT MY FAULT.. the next morning i took a shower, then couldn't get any hot water..i had to take a slightly cold shower and just get to work, at this moment, I am still wondering why a manager haent called me about the 2 bad experiences I already received when this was supposed to be a 5 star hotel from a travel site i learned by like this site...which this site is much better and honest to get this kind of info...anyway,,as i come back to the hotel after working 12 hours,, guess what? my key doesn't work again,,i go back downstairs,,thinking should I scream, or be calm...i nicely tell the the lady at the counter that my key doesn't work AGAIN...she didn't even say, AGAIN? why what happen? could i get a manager for you? NOTHING!!!! so i just pick up my bag and go back to my room...They cleaned my room, thank god,,but NO toilet paper,,,this has to be the first time in my life that when I stayed at a hotel and they cleaned my room, that the cleaning lady forgot the toilet paper....this was the first,,but happening to me only... as I go back downstairs to ask for toilet paper, remember, they do not have anyone that works after 10 pm here..its what it seems,,cause i still havent had 1 manager, or neither 1 employee offer me the toilet paper to my room, I get my toilet paper and go back up to my room, and again, cant get in,,the key doesn't work again...i go back downstairs and ask for another key...next day...take another cold shower..its like they only had a 40 gal water heater for the whole building or something..i then ask for a manager later on that day, and was told she left out of the building for a minute,,i said OK, went back upstairs,,2 hours later, i called downstairs and now that same lady that didn't tell this manager that i wanted her,,,forgot to tell this manager that i wanted her,,,and that she went home...6pm.... couldn't believe it...i had to look around to see if there was any cameras around and that if my friends were in town playing games with me,,and wanted it on camera...like a huge joke..cause sometimes my friends do things like this....it was just getting bad every day and for the same thing...long story short..I finally got to speak a manager,, and SHE said she would take care of this problem and have her general Manager call me..Ive sent an email to them,, and again and again and again...and yet nothing...!!!then the General Manager calls me and tells me he was sorry and he wanted to accommodate me, and I said by what? he offered me to stay again there, and i was like ya right!!! is that a joke or what? then he said he was going to put the money back onto my credit card...and i said ok..this was going on almost 2 months now..and still noting and no reply on my email...so now i gave them plenty of chances and im on here giving my review....Bad service deserves Bad comments!!! simple as that..DO NOT GO HERE OR YOU WILL REGRET IT. i had a better experience staying at a RedRoof inn. and at a cheap hotel that this so call 5 star hotel...someone lied about this hotel on a site similar to this site...I WORK AS A PHOTOGRAPHER FOR UNITED PRESS ASSOC. AND FOR NBC NEWS OUT OF CHICAGO..

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Place to Stay in Indy”
Reviews.Author: IndianaTravelChick
Reviews.Content: This is a top notch place to stay. It is so quiet and elegant. It really feels like you are stepping back in time. The rooms are so clean and nicely organized. The bathrooms are a bit small but suffice. Comfy beds and wonderful professional service.

Reviews.Title: “Split personality”
Reviews.Author: joypaslov
Reviews.Content: Without question the common areas are beautiful. The dark carved wood and gorgeous fireplace truly bring the feel of an old gentleman's club, cigars, scotch and beautiful women with long dresses and hats. A formality from another time. It ends there. While they have renovated one floor and refurbished rooms on that floor, the remainder is a tenement. The hallways have been stripped of wallpaper for months (read June 2011 reviews), the register covers are removed from the walls and there are sounds in the gapping holes. Lights are either out or missing and the hallways are dark and dangerous. Appears to be a real fire trap. Obviously, in the middle of renovation and money ran out. The money problems of this place have been widely known for years (See the Indianapolis Business Journal). Our bed linens were fine, but they covered a full size mattress worn so thin, you could feel springs. The bathroom was not only from the 50's, but filthy tile. The room was half of the size of a normal hotel. The walls pink, drapes didn't close, looked at parking garage with lights flooding into room all night. Furniture was easily 50 years old, think early Walmart, not antiques. Drawers did not open. Television was an old, maybe 18" old fashioned television. Truly appeared decorated by Goodwill. Bottom line was location is wonderful, impressive to people who go there for parties and events. There are good hotels in Indy. Please don't ruin your trip here. If there are no other choices, and your event is downtown, rent a car and go north of 75th street.

Reviews.Title: “Stepping back in time with class!”
Reviews.Author: Pat M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting Indi and happened to fall into and in love with the Columbia Club. Upon first walking into the building we were impressed with the magnificent architecture. Details that can only be experienced in a grand hotel. Call me sappy but I could feel the history and ambiance while walking through the hallways, lounging and dinning areas. All the staff were most accomidating and very friendly. The breakfast buffet was delicious and the variety was much more than a four or five star restaurant. We hope to return in the future and enjoy it all over again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “LOve Love Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nunnyabwax
Reviews.Content: Ok..to each his own... But wow! I love this hotel and staff! 1st time visitor...from Saratoga, NY Historic, beautiful, amazing! What a gem! I actually felt very special here...Room was clean and even bigger than the Conrad (don't really care for the Conrad much)... Give this hotel a try! In fact, try the fitness center too... great staff! Fantastic trainers David & Michelle! You guys rock! thx...

Reviews.Title: “Happily surprised”
Reviews.Author: dpster
Reviews.Content: I tried to book a room at virtually every hotel in downtown Indianapolis, but all of the hotels were already filled. I told my problems to a business colleague who was a member of the Columbia Club, and offered to book a room for me there. I went on-line to read the reviews, and was apprehensive about staying there because so many were negative. Nonetheless, I was desparate to be downtown and booked the room at the Club. I was pleasantly surprised. The best way to reconcile the wildly divergent reviews is to make sure that you request a deluxe room on the deluxe floors, which are the 8th and 9th floors. My room was, in fact, renovated and very nice. It had a very comfortable king bed, a huge bathroom and, again to my surprise, free internet in the room. The room charge for the deluxe room was only $98 per night, compared to the $250 or so that an ordinary business hotel like the Hilton or Sheraton would charge. My room was clean and the service was fine. The place is very quiet with little activity. All in all, this place is fine (if a bit stuffy) if you are seeking a nice room in a well-located downtown hotel at a really modest price. Just make sure to book the deluxe floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Cant understand the bad reviews????”
Reviews.Author: bladams79
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Columbia Club and this is my first trip to Indianapolis. The location is the best in town. The lobby is simply beautiful. This is a private club that lets rooms - I prefer to stay at clubby hotels - ie, Harvard Club in NYC, Sloane in London. I would take this over a typical westin any day of the week. I asked for a renovated room and it is smaller than a "marriott" room, but is just as nice. The common areas are as good as it gets. The best part of this hotel is the price - they dont charge for internet. I had a fantastic room service breakfast, no service charge, no tipping allowed and it was $12 - same meal would have been $35 at a westin. You are allowed to use the members gym which is fine - full service locker rooms, pool, etc. I travel 150,000 miles a year and stay in hotels 75+ nights a year. This is the first "diamond in the rough" I have found in 2011 and can 100% reccommend this hotel - especially for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Call me crazy, but I liked the joint!”
Reviews.Author: The_Gibson
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days while I was in town for business this month. There were a few events going on, so I searched for a hotel, and the Columbia Club was one of few available. After looking at some of the reviews, I was a little hesitant. That said, I think some of the reveiwers are a little off base. First off, the lobby is dripping with history, with a lot of beautiful woodwork and old paintings, etc. The lady at the check in was pleasant, and got me my room quick. The rooms are a little dated, but I was on one of the last two floors to be renovated (I was told the others have been). The bed was nice, the thermostat worked very well, and the windows (GASP!) opened! I ate at the restaurant on the third floor, and was very nice. I also had a good experience with the valet service, as they were efficient and very friendly. The only thing that keeps me from going 5 stars was, as I stated earlier, the room was a little dated and the parking (25 per day, even though it is a downtown) was a little high. Give it a try, it has a dynamite location, there is some history there, and the rooms are pretty nice. If you want the Marriott, go for it, but dollar for dollar, The Columbia goes farther...

Reviews.Title: “Great location - excellent value”
Reviews.Author: compassjohn
Reviews.Content: Basic rooms, nice comfortable downstairs club. Good restaurant and bar. Contrary to other reviews, I found room very clean. A bit dated maybe, but clean. Staff was very helpful. I liked the fact that it was not your basic business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Cabaret at The Columbia Club -- An elegant partnership.”
Reviews.Author: notbeautfuljustloser
Reviews.Content: My review is centered on my experience attending a recent performance of The Cabaret, located in the Crystal Terrace of the Columbia Club, overlooking the nighttime ambiance of Monument Circle. I concede my review is limited in that I did not stay overnight in one of the hotel rooms. I did enjoy several drinks (with a designated driver among us). Drinks and service were excellent: everything was precisely made and served. I believe our server was Diana. It is difficult to overstate the richly atmospheric charm of the Crystal Terrace, on the third-floor of the Columbia Club, once the house lights go down and the evening, with little conscious effort, becomes lost and tangled in New York City, circa 1920s. The staffs of the Cabaret and the Columbia Club, like co-conspirators in the magic, didn't break the spell as they seated and served us. Everyone from my party had a fabulous experience at the Columbia Club and, especially, at the Cabaret. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and Shady”
Reviews.Author: dougy33
Reviews.Content: We were spoken down to numerous times while at the "club" for the 2 nights. We were then charged for smoking in the room (all non smokers). We were also charged for valet both nights (we valeted ONE night). We were told to LEAVE a floor and "linger somewhere else" due to a private party that was coming.....we were waiting for the elevator. Security came into our room and took pictures of "damage" and we were escorted out when we asked about the charges.

Reviews.Title: “Go to another hotel in the area”
Reviews.Author: roncat18
Reviews.Content: This is actually an old club converted into a hotel. The lobby is beautiful and the room for events on the 12th floor is lovely. The hotel rooms are awful. Only the top two floors have been renovated. These rooms are passable as long as they are clean. Check closely. I stayed on the 5th floor which was disgusting. My room had not been renovated in too many years to count. There was no where to put bathroom toiletries, no shelf at all in the bathroom. My shower handle was broken and we did not have hot water. Our carpet was dirty and buckled. We did not have an extra roll of toilet paper nor glasses to drink out of . Our TV was a 19 inch tube TV that barely worked. The entire hotel needs to be renovated except for the lobby. I would stay anywhere else. Run to another hotel. The service in the Restaurant was awful, don't eat there either.

Reviews.Title: “better places close by for the $ - go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: mbjm17
Reviews.Content: We were there as part of a family event at the Columbia Club - and wish we had stayed in one of the other hotels that were options. Our room was a renovated one, but housekeeping missed cleaning the toilet - which was disgusting. Granted, the mess of it was not in your vision but it shows you that their cleaning is just superficial. Management was useless in resolving the situation. Upper level rooms/floors 8 and 9 have been renovated and are worth the price if you must stay here. lower floor rooms are old and disgusting. Food is average, service in the restaurant is non-existent. Building is historic, lobby is beautiful. Location is great but so many other real hotels on Monument Circle (this is not a hotel - don't be misled by the fact that they rent rooms, there is no customer service and onsite managment has no authority to make decisions) - go to one of the other name hotels instead- you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: 23lucy
Reviews.Content: As we arrived to this hotel the 10 valets at the door looked at us as if we were some low class people and said that was a ´private´club and my reply was ´we are guest here´. The lobby smells and the rooms are very very dated. We had to call the front desk because our bathroom and curtains were dirty! Wouldn´t recommend it. There are a lot of new hotels around the downtown area that would definitely give a better service for your money. This people are trying to live up to their wonder years back in the 1800´s but wake up! it´s 2010!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, crummy rooms”
Reviews.Author: RJP-90
Reviews.Content: Well I suppose I should have heeded the advice of other reviewers and paid that extra cash for a newly renovated room. We stayed here recently for a wedding - the reception hall was nice, the food pretty mediocre but what can you expect from a buffet? The biggest disappointment was the room - the entire place (room, lobby, etc.) has a pretty musty smell. The bathroom literally reminded me of a truck stop bathroom with cheap tile and home depot fixtures - they tried to class it up by placing a bunch of plates with fancy soap around but failed miserably. The shower had terrible pressure. The swimming pool, located in the basement looks like somewhere one might go to be murdered. And to top it off the parking was a ridiculous $25 a night! To sum it up, I would not stay here again - there are plenty of other similarly priced hotels in the area that don't smell like grandma's basement.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Style with Tradition in the Towns most favorible location”
Reviews.Author: kdr3
Reviews.Content: The Columbia Club was a terrific experience my wife and I enjoyed thoroughly. Elegant old world tradition with fine accommodations. We came for the Indy 500 and the Club did a wonderful job from the moment we arrived till the time we left. Was surprised to see many different reactions online, but as the times change as to the Clubs and Hotels. Yes they will host non-members now (US) but if you want to survive they need the revenue. Although they have changed their membership they have not changed their philosophy of the service they provide...Top notch and truly a treat. Thanks Very Much KDR3

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Cb1018
Reviews.Content: Extremely dirty room; white socks were black from the carpeting. Room smelled of cigarette smoke; bed was extremely uncomfortable. Bath tub had rust on the drain. Tap water was rust colored. Room service messed order up on two occassions. Vehicle was crashed by valet. Employees were polite and helpful. An overall disappointing stay. Location was fantastic. Next time, Mariott bound

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasantly Different Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dave_in_Indy
Reviews.Content: I've read all of the reviews to-date regarding the Columbia Club. I understand some of the negative reviews, particularly had they been booked into the rooms not yet remodeled/updated. Last summer (July 2008), I booked two nights for 14 guests from my company who were coming to town from all across the country. The weather during our three day stay in Indy (my home town) was simply gorgeous, so we had THAT going for us. All of the guests were pleasantly surprised by the main lobby experience - it's a grand ol' dark wood and colored glass affair with very large windows looking out onto The Circle (although the main desk is a cramped affair also handling club health facility registration, minor vending functions, and more). The main stairs are marble and wood, and the elevators have the old world feel to them, but are relatively modern (read: quick and steady). Should you book this hotel (and I had been forewarned), make sure to request the remodeled rooms - mostly directly on the Circle - although SOME of the rooms on the Circle have NOT been remodeled, so don't just asks for rooms on the Circle, ask for recently remodeled rooms). The remodeled rooms, to our experience, were very comfortable, large, and spotless. They were not at all ultra-luxurious as you'd find in the Conrad or a Four Seasons hotel, but they had upscale bed linens and bath towels, and were consistent with the amenities/furnishings of a 4 star hotel. All guests reported being highly pleased with not only the rooms, but the service received in the hotel. It's hard to disprove a negative (the tales related by one of the earlier reviewers (e.g. the "hispanic cleaning lady" and her non-hygenic ways, or the rather snooty take on the alleged desperation of a private club and their non-health-concious menu). So I won't try. I'll say with enthusiasm that these types of thing were not at all our experience and reflect a characterization of quality-of-service that is quite the opposite of ours. The relatively small, but high quality/"Mad Men" like bar was a GREAT place for our group to gather over a few drinks before heading out of an evening for dinner (we did not eat in the club - although I've eaten there before and the food was very good, not the best food experience in Indy but WAY far from a poor quality experience). They ARE light on the grass-clipping type of nutritional fare preferred by some; this is afterall Indianapolis's bastion of Republican business hob-nobbing (I'm NOT a Republican, but the menu reflects stereotypical meat 'n potatoes, or salmon 'n potatoes, Republican tastes). Both dining areas are great places to eat - the Crystal Room is a large, open room with linen tablecloths, marble floors, very high ceilings with rich wood trim, and large windows out onto the Circle - the main dining room downstairs is more the old "hunt club" type of experience, with a bit more modern take than "hunt club" would imply. It's the more intimate of the two rooms, and where dinner is held (the upstairs Crystal Room is primarily for business lunches, where high-visibility business contacts are made and renewed ... I recommend The Columbia Club heartily to anyone looking for a uniquely Indianapolis hotel experience, and one right on The Circle. Circling back to my intro, it was absolutely stunning for us to walk out of the hotel onto The Circle, with the huge waterfalls and open, brick covered pedestrian mall feel of the monument area. Our guests loved it, thankful for a change from the normal, but also quite wonderful, corporate chain hotel experiences we normally book (W, Marriott, Hilton or Conrad, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Columbia Club--interesting”
Reviews.Author: MHCFortWayne_IN
Reviews.Content: The Columbia Club was a private club, members only, but has gone public. I got a very reasonable rate and my husband and I stayed 3 nights. The club is on Monument Circle, right downtown Indianapolis. You can't beat the location. The room was pleasant, nothing exceptional, clean and comfortable with windows that open!. The hotel itself is amazing, a beautiful architectural gem. The first two floors are stunning, with one of those neat marble staircases. There is a ballroom on one floor, and some private clubs upstairs. There are only 10 floors. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is formal, with doormen, valet parking, bellhops, the whole bit. Parking is $22 a night and you pretty much have to do that, since you're downtown and there's little parking available. You can have the car brought to you and use it as often as you want for that price. There is a dress code for the Bistro, but doesn't seem to be too heavily enforced. While we were there, the place was fairly empty, so it was quiet and a little eerie. It's not your usual Marriott or Holiday Inn but if you're up for something a little different, give it a try. I enjoyed it. We usually stay at B&B's so this was quite different, but not like a standard hotel. We ate breakfast there one morning and it was good.

Reviews.Title: “I was disapointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: travler0u812
Reviews.Content: First of all you do not need be a member of The Colombia Club to stay there. I was in Indianapolis on buisness and was going to stay at Hilton but they were booked. The people at the Hilton called over to The Columbia Club and got me a room. The staff at the front desk were the only enjoyable thing there. The building itself is suposed to have this historic feel and vibe. It fails badly! The rooms need to be updated so bad. They look like cheap rooms from the late 80's. The room service took a long time and was awfull. Food was not good!!! I will not go back there, and iam in Indianapolis alot for work. It reminded me of the hotel in "The Shining".

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: CEF909
Reviews.Content: I am a member of the Columbia Club and decided to book a suite for the weekend. We chose a renovated room facing Monument Circle. Everything in the room was new and beautifully decorated. Marble bathrooms, brass fixtures, elegant linens. Dinner in the Harrison Room amidst butter colored leather seating and mahogany paneled walls accompanied by a first rate pianist playing the Steinway while Dover Sole was served tableside. You must be a member of a reciprocal club or be sponsored by a member. Virtually every American president has stayed here. Be sure to view President Harrison's grand desk in the foyer and the magnificent lobby's custom woodworking.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Private Club”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, you must be a member of a private club that has a reciprocal agreement with the Columbia Club or be sponsored by a member to stay there. Traveling from California, I arranged for my club to reserve a room at the CC for three nights. Located on Monument Circle in downtown Indianapolis, this venerable 1930s 10 story club looks like something out of a 1940 British mens's club. Beautiful wood paneling and red leather wing chairs, butter colored leather chairs and booths in the bar and Harrison Room, two other restaurants and bars in the Club. Rooms on several floors have been gutted and beautifully refurbished with all the amenities of a 5 star hotel. Staff is cordial, discreet and accomodating. I can understand why every recent American president has stayed here. This is truly a rare gem in a city that is vibrant and on the move. If you can manage a reservation, by all means stay or at least visit ------.
